title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian stock markets saw a sharp decline on Thursday. The Nifty dropped significantly as investors worried about potential US tariffs. Foreign institutional investors continued to sell shares. Global markets also showed weakness. Analysts expect the market to remain under pressure in the near term. The India VIX, a measure of market fear, surged. The rupee weakened against the US dollar.

title: Stocks in news: RIL, BHEL, NTPC, Bharat Forge, Ashok Leyland
summary: Markets closed lower on Thursday due to weak global cues, with the Nifty breaching a key support level. Several companies are in focus today: Bharat Forge partnered with Agile Robots for AI automation, BHEL secured a coal gasification order, RIL may consider buying Venezuelan oil, NTPC plans nuclear power projects, and Ashok Leyland inaugurates its new EV plant.

title: Asian stocks edge up before US jobs data, tariff ruling
summary: Asian equities saw a modest rise after a two-day decline, as investors awaited US payrolls data and a potential Supreme Court ruling on President Trump's tariffs.  Money has shifted from tech giants to smaller companies, with the Russell 2000 outperforming the Nasdaq 100.  US jobs data will offer clues on the Federal Reserve's interest rate path.

title: Will proposed US tariffs trigger further Indian market decline? Experts weigh in
summary: Indian stock markets experienced a significant drop on Thursday, with major indices falling around 1 percent. This decline, the steepest since August, was triggered by news of proposed steep tariffs on Russian oil imports. Investors are now closely watching the US Supreme Court's decision on the legality of these tariffs.

title: RBI plans cooling-off for UCB directors
summary: The Reserve Bank of India is proposing new guidelines for co-operative banking, mandating a three-year cooling-off period for urban co-operative bank directors after a decade of continuous service. During this time, directors can only be members or customers, though they may serve on other bank boards.

title: Bajaj Finserv completes acquisition of Allianz stake in insurance JVs
summary: Bajaj Finserv and its promoter group have acquired a combined 97% stake in Bajaj Allianz General Insurance and Bajaj Allianz Life Insurance from Allianz SE, concluding a 20-year partnership.  The transactions, finalized through share purchase agreements, significantly increased Bajaj Finserv's direct holdings to 75.01% in both entities.

title: FPI Registration: Sebi allows digital signatures
summary: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has simplified the foreign portfolio investor (FPI) registration process by introducing digital signatures. This new functionality, integrated into the common application form (CAF) portal, allows applicants to apply for DSC directly while submitting their registration, creating a unified and streamlined onboarding experience.

title: Electronics stocks need a spark of profit for D-St vibe
summary: JP Morgan anticipates 2026 will be a crucial year for India's electronics manufacturing services (EMS) sector, with stocks facing a significant test after underperforming in 2025. A sustained recovery for these shares will depend on companies demonstrating improved profitability, with key triggers including the extension of the mobile PLI scheme and the rollout of ISM 2.0.

title: Exporters shares slump on US warning of higher tariffs
summary: Indian exporter shares fell sharply. Donald Trump's support for a bill proposing 500% tariffs on Indian imports caused panic. This could significantly increase existing tariffs. Textile, apparel, seafood, and drug makers saw their shares drop. Experts advise caution and focusing on domestic companies. Clarity on the tariffs is awaited.

summary: The step-up was triggered after Goswami Infratech, a borrower linked to the structure, did not complete a refinancing by December end, said the people cited above. title: Deepinder Goyal breaks silence amid criticism over Temple device from doctors, influencers : ‘We’re months away from…’
summary: Deepinder Goyal, CEO of Eternal, confirmed that no public announcements have been made regarding the health device Temple. He emphasised the lack of official data and criticised doctors advising against an unvalidated device that is not yet available.

title: OpenAI says AI products for healthcare sector to be complaint with US' HIPAA requirements. Here's why this is important
summary: OpenAI announced its products to help healthcare organisations deliver high-quality patient care while ensuring HIPAA compliance. Here's why HIPAA is important and how the ChatGPT-maker aims to comply with US privacy and disclosure laws for its products.

title: Reliance Industries loses $15 billion market cap in bruising start to 2026
summary: Reliance Industries Ltd. is off to bruising start to the year, with shares down more than 6% as investors digest weak retail outlooks and tougher US rhetoric on India’s Russian oil purchases — putting the onus on upcoming earnings to arrest the slide.

title: Multibagger watchlist: 10 stocks surge over 20% for 3 straight quarters in FY26. Do you own any?
summary: In FY26, only ten actively traded stocks with market capitalisation above Rs 2,000 crore delivered consistent gains across three consecutive quarters. Strong participation and sustained momentum turned these stocks into multibaggers within the fiscal year, rewarding early investors with substantial wealth creation.

title: WazirX completes allocation of Recovery Tokens, distributes 85% of rebalanced net liquid platform assets to users within 10 days
summary: WazirX has completed the allocation of Recovery Tokens to eligible users under its court-approved scheme and distributed around 85% of rebalanced net liquid platform assets within 10 business days, enabling users to participate proportionally in future recoveries.

title: Manappuram Finance shares tumble 10% on report of RBI objections to Bain Capital deal
summary: Manappuram Finance shares fell 10% after a Reuters report said the RBI has objected to Bain Capital’s plan to acquire a controlling stake. Heavy volumes marked the sell-off as investors assessed regulatory risks surrounding the proposed investment.

title: Bernstein picks Eternal’s Blinkit to outpace Swiggy, Zepto in 2026 but says ‘brace for volatility’
summary: Bernstein expects Blinkit to maintain its lead over rivals in 2026, backed by stronger operating metrics and lower cash burn, though competition may keep profits and stock returns volatile. The brokerage names Eternal as its top pick and sets a target price of Rs 370, implying 31% upside.

title: Nifty to reach 29,500 by 2026-end, BNP Paribas says, backing HDFC Bank, Maruti Suzuki among top bets
summary: BNP Paribas sees the Nifty 50 rising to 29,500 by end-2026, driven by earnings growth. The brokerage favours large, domestically focused stocks, citing policy support, easing financial conditions and a gradual recovery in consumption.

title: SoftBank offloads 2.15% stake in Ola Electric via open market
summary: Japanese multinational investment firm SoftBank, has sold 2.15 per cent of its holdings in Ola Electric mobility through its investment vehicle SVF II Ostrich (DE) LLC, according to a regulatory filing.

title: Akasa Air joins global airlines' association IATA after completing mandatory safety audit — details here
summary: Akasa Air has joined international aviation association IATA, after completing the Operational Safety Audit. It became the fifth Indian airline to join the group. Details here.

title: SoftBank cuts stake in Ola Electric again, now owns 13.53%. Check details
summary: SoftBank sold a 2.15% stake in Ola Electric, reducing its ownership from 15.68% to 13.53% through open market transactions from September 2025 to January 2026. This follows a previous stake sale from 17.83% to 15.68%.&nbsp;

title: Gainers & Losers: NALCO among 8 stocks that were under the spotlight on Friday
summary: Indian markets extended losses for a fifth straight session as tariff concerns weighed on sentiment. Stocks such as Manappuram Finance, IEX and Elecon Engineering declined sharply, while Mazagon Dock, BHEL, NALCO and Hindustan Zinc saw buying interest.

title: BSE launches All Derivative Stocks Index to track F&O-linked BSE 500 stocks
summary: BSE Index Services launched the BSE All Derivative Stocks Index to track derivative-eligible BSE 500 stocks, using market-cap and momentum weighting, reflecting India’s growing equity derivatives depth and offering a new benchmark for passive and active investment products nationwide participants.

title: Bad start to 2026 as Rs 9 lakh crore lost in 5 days. What should stock market investors do?
summary: Indian equities suffered a brutal start to the year as global trade fears, Trump tariff threats and heavy foreign selling dragged Sensex down over 2,000 points, erasing Rs 9 lakh crore and pushing markets into a risk-off, high-volatility phase nationwide.

title: DMart Q3 results preview: Will Radhakishan Damani-backed Avenue Supermarts report healthy December quarter earnings?
summary: As DMart gears up to announce its Q3 FY26 results, analysts predict flat to modest earnings growth. While revenue is expected to rise 13% YoY, rising costs and competitive pressures may compress margins.&nbsp;

title: RIL, ONGC to OMCs: What to expect from the oil and gas sector in Q3FY26 results?
summary: Nuvama Institutional Equities, in a note, said that it forecasts O&amp;G’s Q3FY26E aggregate EBITDA to jump 17% YoY, led by OMCs/RIL/CGDs, partially offset by ONGC and gas utilities.

title: Sebi eases tech glitch rules for brokers, drops most small firms from compliance net
summary: Sebi estimates that this change will take nearly 60% of brokers out of the framework, effectively exempting a large number of small and mid-sized firms that have limited scale and lower dependence on complex trading technology

title: US Supreme Court tariff decision likely today. How the US stock market may open today?
summary: The US stock market is set for a cautious opening as traders prepare for key risk events, including the Supreme Court's verdict on Trump's tariffs. The outcome could significantly impact US trade policy, economic health, and market performance in the near future.

title: Blackstone checks into Taj Aravali Udaipur, buys 50% stake for $100 million
summary: The hospitality sector is a relatively new bet for Blackstone in India, which is a leading player across real estate asset classes including commercial office, retail and logistics and warehousing.&nbsp;

title: BlackRock predicts major shift in retail investors' access to cryptocurrencies
summary: It could be the year Main Street's appetite for cryptocurrency exposure meaningfully grows.

title: Stock Market Holiday? NSE to remain open on January 15 during Maharashtra civil polls
summary: The Indian exchange NSE will operate for regular trading on January 15, despite Maharashtra's public holiday for civic polls. While trading will proceed, January 15 is designated a settlement holiday, meaning T+0 settlements will not be processed. Consequently, T+1 trades from both January 14 and 15 will be settled on January 16.

title: 10 mid-cap stocks with EBITDA margins over 50%. Do you own any?
summary: StocksEdge data highlights ten mid-cap non-financial companies delivering over 50% EBITDA margins in FY25, led by NTPC Green Energy and SJVN, reflecting superior operating efficiency, resilient profitability and strong execution across diverse sectors.

title: ITC and 5 other stocks hit 52-week lows; slip up to 21% in a month
summary: Six BSE 200 stocks, including ITC, Siemens Energy India and Jubilant FoodWorks, hit fresh 52-week lows on Friday as market weakness dragged them down up to 21% over the past month.

title: NSE, BSE to hold mock trading session on Saturday. Can investors trade? All you need to know
summary: Indian stock exchanges NSE and BSE will conduct a mock trading session on Saturday, allowing brokers to test systems, risk controls and contingency mechanisms under simulated conditions. The drill includes call auctions, block deals and an outage scenario to validate Sebi’s alternate trading venue framework. No live trading will occur.

title: Sebi eases technical glitch norms for stock brokers, cuts compliance burden for smaller firms
summary: SEBI revamped technical glitch norms for brokers, easing compliance by limiting applicability to firms with over 10,000 clients, simplifying reporting, granting exemptions, and rationalising penalties, offering relief to smaller brokers while maintaining technology, risk management and market integrity standards nationwide.

title: Dollar extends gains with jobs data and potential tariff ruling in focus
summary: The dollar has added to the year’s early gains but two big risks are looming.

title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO see bumper demand, subscribed over 8x on first; GMP signals 45% listing gains
summary: The demand for BCCL IPO remained strong from all quotas, with the qualified institutional segment (QIB) booked 30%. The non-institutional investor (NII) and retail investor quotas garnered 16.39 times and 9.26 times bids, respectively.

title: Nifty would have plunged to 20K without retail, DIIs’: Gurmeet Chadha calls for rewarding patient risk capital
summary: Market veteran Gurmeet Chadha credited retail investors and DIIs for supporting Nifty amid heavy FII selling, citing record SIP inflows as proof of resilient long-term domestic capital and urging policy incentives to reward patient investors.

title: Pulse of the Street: A five-day rout makes market jittery
summary: Markets tumbled as US-driven shocks, tariff threats, and global uncertainty triggered India’s worst weekly performance. Nifty and Sensex suffered steep declines ahead of the Q3 earnings season.

title: General Motors stock in focus after EV charges rise to $7.6 billion
summary: GM announces it will take another $6 billion in charges related to production cuts in electric vehicle and battery operations

title: ₹23.85 to  ₹1,400: Multibagger stock turns  ₹1 lakh into  ₹64 lakh in four years
summary: Network People Services Technologies closed higher in three out of the last four calendar years, delivering multibagger returns in three of those years. 2023 was the standout year, with a surge of 1012%.&nbsp;

title: Meta signs major nuclear energy contracts for AI infrastructure amid demand surge
summary: Meta Platforms has agreed to purchase nuclear energy from Vistra Corp. and support upcoming reactors from Oklo and TerraPower. Th

title: Who is Kedar Lele? Haleon announces ex-Castrol India MD as new president for India subcontinent
summary: Kedar Lele has been appointed President of Haleon India, bringing over 25 years of experience from companies like Castrol and Hindustan Unilever. He will lead efforts to enhance Haleon's consumer reach and align with its strategic goals for better health solutions.

title: Sebi proposes uniform trading disclosures, higher net-worth for margin trading
summary: India's markets regulator on ‍Friday proposed to ​issue a uniform set of trading-related ⁠disclosure requirements to standardise compliance across India's three stock exchanges and two commodity exchanges.

title: Gold rates today: MCX gold jumps  ₹1,160 per 10g, silver rallies  ₹7,476 per kg on soft US jobs data
summary: The February gold future contracts on MCX surged  ₹1,160 per 10 grams to reach  ₹1,38,902. Silver prices saw renewed buying interest, with March silver future contracts gaining  ₹7,476 per kilogram, or 3%, to cross the  ₹2.5 lakh mark, reaching  ₹2,50,800.

title: Wall Street gains after weak jobs data
summary: At 09:41 a.m. ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.31%, the S&amp;P 500 gained 0.37%, the Nasdaq Composite gained 0.38%

title: Trump will use other tariff authorities to get to 'same place' if Supreme Court rules against him: Hassett
summary: Kevin Hassett said the White House could deploy alternative tariff authorities if the Supreme Court rules against President Donald Trump.

title: Sebi proposes to simplify trading-related framework at stock exchanges
summary: Markets regulator Sebi on Friday proposed an overhaul of the trading-related framework at stock exchanges, aimed at simplifying rules, removing duplication, and reducing the compliance burden for market participants.

title: Tata Capital block deal: Societe Generale buys additional stake worth Rs 51 cr; anchor investor sells
summary: Societe Generale bought 14.33 lakh Tata Capital shares via a Rs 51 crore block deal after anchor lock-in expiry, while Marshall Wace exited an equal stake. The stock rose to Rs 359.85 following India’s largest 2025 IPO this week today

title: ET Prime Special: Investing lessons from Warren Buffett - Part 2. Navigating a transformative phase. The year is 1978
summary: Stock markets often price minority stakes at significant discounts to intrinsic value. That is, the combined value of its shares is less than the value of a company if it were to be sold. This creates opportunities for investors to own pieces of great businesses at attractive prices. Warren Buffett figured this out almost half a century ago and was willing to own large minority stakes in well-managed companies without seeking control. This principle guided many of his most successful investments in the decades to come. In this new ET Prime Special Series, we will bring you insights every week from the legendary investor and also tell you how Berkshire Hathaway performed year after year to become what it is today. This is for people who are keen to learn what wealth creation is all about.

title: Sebi proposes sweeping clean-up of trading, margin rules
summary: Proposals span margin trading norms, market making, SME listings and commodity derivatives as the regulator targets a simpler, consolidated trading framework.

title: Sebi allows AIFs to begin investor onboarding before accreditation
summary: Sebi has clarified that investor commitments will count only after accreditation, and funds can be accepted only once certification is complete.

title: MTAR Technologies bulk deal: BofA buys 2 lakh shares worth Rs 55 crore
summary: Bank of America acquired over 2 lakh shares of MTAR Technologies for Rs 55 crore in a bulk deal, paying a 6% premium. MTAR Technologies shares surged 6.69% to Rs 2,688.30, hitting a 52-week high. The company, involved in high-precision engineering for aerospace and energy, reported a decline in net profit and revenue for the September 2025 quarter.

title: Akzo Nobel India names Parth Jindal as Chairman with immediate effect
summary: Akzo Nobel India appoints Parth Jindal as Chairman.

title: Amazon's internal review process ‘Forte’ requires employees to list accomplishments. Here's what we know
summary: Amazon is asking employees to submit three to five accomplishments for its performance review process, Forte. This marks a shift towards individual achievement recognition, which will also impact the remuneration of employees.

title: Stock picks of the week: 5 stocks with consistent score improvement and upside potential of up to 35%
summary: In a bullish market, you need to be selective and cautious about buying. And in a bearish one, you need to be careful about selling. There is, however, a third aspect. Which is when the markets are not in any clear directional mode and are readjusting to the latest earnings numbers because valuations are high. In such a scenario, it is important that you look at every sector and company and their operating and valuation matrices separately. Our selected stocks for today depict a strong upward trajectory in their overall average score which is based on five key pillars: Earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum. This implies that there has been a significant improvement in their market outlook in the given time frame.

summary: USA-TRUMP/OIL (REPEAT, PIX):RPT-US oil firms juggle Venezuela opportunity, investor concern ahead of White House summit

title: First Brands Sues Founder’s Brother, Largest Creditor for Fraud
summary: Bankrupt auto-parts maker First Brands Group has sued Edward James — its former executive and the brother of company founder Patrick James — and its largest creditor Onset Financial for conspiring “to defraud creditors out of billions of dollars and property.”
